remarks: An increasing sequence of positive integers takes on indefinitely large values.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
statement:
incsequz2 $p |- ( ( F : NN --> NN /\ A. m e. NN ( F ` m ) < ( F ` ( m + 1 ) ) /\ A e. NN ) -> E. n e. NN A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` n ) ( F ` k ) e. ( ZZ>= ` A ) ) $.
$d A k m n $.
$d F k m n $.
